channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Verbosity $\neq$ Veracity: Demystify Verbosity Compensation Behavior of Large Language Models
item.description: 2) We reveal the large performance gap between verbose and concise responses, with a notable difference of 27. 61% on the Qasper dataset.

item.title: MureObjectStitch: Multi-reference Image Composition
item.description: Generative image composition aims to regenerate the given foreground object in the background image to produce a realistic composite image.

item.title: Language Models as Causal Effect Generators
item.description: In particular, we define a procedure for turning any language model and any directed acyclic graph (DAG) into a sequence-driven structural causal model (SD-SCM).

item.title: Interaction Asymmetry: A General Principle for Learning Composable Abstractions
item.description: Using this formalism, we prove that interaction asymmetry enables both disentanglement and compositional generalization.

item.title: Automatic Album Sequencing
item.description: To address this, we introduce a new user-friendly web-based tool that allows a less technical audience to upload music tracks, execute this technique in one click, and subsequently presents the result in a clean visualization to the user.

item.title: A Stochastic Optimization Framework for Private and Fair Learning From Decentralized Data
item.description: In this paper, we develop a novel algorithm for private and fair federated learning (FL).

item.title: Accident Impact Prediction based on a deep convolutional and recurrent neural network model
item.description: The development of predictive models capable of real-time forecasting of post-accident impact using readily available data can play a crucial role in preventing adverse outcomes and enhancing overall safety.

item.title: Learning Memory Mechanisms for Decision Making through Demonstrations
item.description: In Partially Observable Markov Decision Processes, integrating an agent's history into memory poses a significant challenge for decision-making.

item.title: Problem-Oriented Segmentation and Retrieval: Case Study on Tutoring Conversations
item.description: Many open-ended conversations (e. g., tutoring lessons or business meetings) revolve around pre-defined reference materials, like worksheets or meeting bullets.

item.title: Advancing Sustainability via Recommender Systems: A Survey
item.description: Human behavioral patterns and consumption paradigms have emerged as pivotal determinants in environmental degradation and climate change, with quotidian decisions pertaining to transportation, energy utilization, and resource consumption collectively precipitating substantial ecological impacts.

item.title: CDXFormer: Boosting Remote Sensing Change Detection with Extended Long Short-Term Memory
item.description: In this paper, we propose CDXFormer, with a core component that is a powerful XLSTM-based feature enhancement layer, integrating the advantages of linear computational complexity, global context perception, and strong interpret-ability.

item.title: Semi-Truths: A Large-Scale Dataset of AI-Augmented Images for Evaluating Robustness of AI-Generated Image detectors
item.description: Text-to-image diffusion models have impactful applications in art, design, and entertainment, yet these technologies also pose significant risks by enabling the creation and dissemination of misinformation.

item.title: MSEG-VCUQ: Multimodal SEGmentation with Enhanced Vision Foundation Models, Convolutional Neural Networks, and Uncertainty Quantification for High-Speed Video Phase Detection Data
item.description: Purpose: High-speed video (HSV) phase detection (PD) segmentation is vital in nuclear reactors, chemical processing, and electronics cooling for detecting vapor, liquid, and microlayer phases.

item.title: Prompt-enhanced Network for Hateful Meme Classification
item.description: Specifically, after constructing the sequence through the prompt method and encoding it with a language model, we performed region information global extraction on the encoded sequence for multi-view perception.

item.title: PatchCTG: Patch Cardiotocography Transformer for Antepartum Fetal Health Monitoring
item.description: Antepartum Cardiotocography (CTG) is vital for fetal health monitoring, but traditional methods like the Dawes-Redman system are often limited by high inter-observer variability, leading to inconsistent interpretations and potential misdiagnoses.

item.title: An Attack Traffic Identification Method Based on Temporal Spectrum
item.description: To address the issues of insufficient robustness, unstable features, and data noise interference in existing network attack detection and identification models, this paper proposes an attack traffic detection and identification method based on temporal spectrum.

item.title: HiCoM: Hierarchical Coherent Motion for Streamable Dynamic Scene with 3D Gaussian Splatting
item.description: The online reconstruction of dynamic scenes from multi-view streaming videos faces significant challenges in training, rendering and storage efficiency.

item.title: Horticultural Temporal Fruit Monitoring via 3D Instance Segmentation and Re-Identification using Point Clouds
item.description: Experimental results on a real dataset of strawberries demonstrate that our approach outperforms other methods for fruits re-identification over time, allowing for precise temporal fruit monitoring in real and complex scenarios.

item.title: Fair Summarization: Bridging Quality and Diversity in Extractive Summaries
item.description: This work highlights the importance of fairness in summarization and sets a benchmark for future research in fairness-aware NLP models.

item.title: Privacy-Preserving Verifiable Neural Network Inference Service
item.description: In this paper, we propose vPIN, a privacy-preserving and verifiable CNN inference scheme that preserves privacy for client data samples while ensuring verifiability for the inference.

item.title: What Do Learning Dynamics Reveal About Generalization in LLM Reasoning?
item.description: We find that a model's generalization behavior can be effectively characterized by a training metric we call pre-memorization train accuracy: the accuracy of model samples on training queries before they begin to copy the exact reasoning steps from the training set.

item.title: Mitigating Bias in Queer Representation within Large Language Models: A Collaborative Agent Approach
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) often perpetuate biases in pronoun usage, leading to misrepresentation or exclusion of queer individuals.

item.title: Doubly Mild Generalization for Offline Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Even under worst-case generalization, DMG can still control value overestimation at a certain level and lower bound the performance.

item.title: DecoPrompt : Decoding Prompts Reduces Hallucinations when Large Language Models Meet False Premises
item.description: While large language models (LLMs) have demonstrated increasing power, they have also called upon studies on their hallucinated outputs that deviate from factually correct statements.

item.title: SparrowVQE: Visual Question Explanation for Course Content Understanding
item.description: We trained our model with a three-stage training mechanism consisting of multimodal pre-training (slide images and transcripts feature alignment), instruction tuning (tuning the pre-trained model with transcripts and QA pairs), and domain fine-tuning (fine-tuning slide image and QA pairs).

item.title: Isometric Transformations for Image Augmentation in Mueller Matrix Polarimetry
item.description: This study underscores the necessity of physics-informed data augmentation for polarimetric imaging in deep learning (DL), paving the way for broader adoption and more robust applications across diverse research in the field.

item.title: Optimal Control of Mechanical Ventilators with Learned Respiratory Dynamics
item.description: We implement and compare controllers based on clinical guidelines contained in the ARDSnet protocol, optimal control theory, and learned latent dynamics represented as neural networks.

item.title: Large-scale Remote Sensing Image Target Recognition and Automatic Annotation
item.description: This paper presents a method for object recognition and automatic labeling in large-area remote sensing images called LRSAA.

item.title: Breaking the Low-Rank Dilemma of Linear Attention
item.description: The Softmax attention mechanism in Transformer models is notoriously computationally expensive, particularly due to its quadratic complexity, posing significant challenges in vision applications.

item.title: FM-TS: Flow Matching for Time Series Generation
item.description: FM-TS is more efficient in terms of training and inference.

item.title: Sleep Staging from Airflow Signals Using Fourier Approximations of Persistence Curves
item.description: Sleep staging is a challenging task, typically manually performed by sleep technologists based on electroencephalogram and other biosignals of patients taken during overnight sleep studies.

item.title: Material Transforms from Disentangled NeRF Representations
item.description: In this paper, we first propose a novel method for transferring material transformations across different scenes.

item.title: Joint multi-dimensional dynamic attention and transformer for general image restoration
item.description: Outdoor images often suffer from severe degradation due to rain, haze, and noise, impairing image quality and challenging high-level tasks.

item.title: Likelihood as a Performance Gauge for Retrieval-Augmented Generation
item.description: Based on these findings, we propose two methods that use question likelihood as a gauge for selecting and constructing prompts that lead to better performance.

item.title: SAMPart3D: Segment Any Part in 3D Objects
item.description: For flexibility, we distill scale-conditioned part-aware 3D features for 3D part segmentation at multiple granularities.

item.title: ENAT: Rethinking Spatial-temporal Interactions in Token-based Image Synthesis
item.description: At the spatial level, we disentangle the computations of visible and mask tokens by encoding visible tokens independently, while decoding mask tokens conditioned on the fully encoded visible tokens.

item.title: Token Merging for Training-Free Semantic Binding in Text-to-Image Synthesis
item.description: In this paper, we define semantic binding as the task of associating a given object with its attribute, termed attribute binding, or linking it to other related sub-objects, referred to as object binding.

item.title: ConvMixFormer- A Resource-efficient Convolution Mixer for Transformer-based Dynamic Hand Gesture Recognition
item.description: We have considered this drawback of the transformer and designed a resource-efficient model that replaces the self-attention in the transformer with the simple convolutional layer-based token mixer.

item.title: AssistRAG: Boosting the Potential of Large Language Models with an Intelligent Information Assistant
item.description: The emergence of Large Language Models (LLMs) has significantly advanced natural language processing, but these models often generate factually incorrect information, known as "hallucination".

item.title: The Super Weight in Large Language Models
item.description: For weight quantization, we similarly find that by preserving the super weight and clipping other weight outliers, round-to-nearest quantization can scale to much larger block sizes than previously considered.

item.title: Fast and Efficient Transformer-based Method for Bird's Eye View Instance Prediction
item.description: Accurate object detection and prediction are critical to ensure the safety and efficiency of self-driving architectures.

item.title: 'Explaining RL Decisions with Trajectories': A Reproducibility Study
item.description: This work investigates the reproducibility of the paper 'Explaining RL decisions with trajectories'.

item.title: Large-scale moral machine experiment on large language models
item.description: Here, we evaluate moral judgments across 51 different LLMs, including multiple versions of proprietary models (GPT, Claude, Gemini) and open-source alternatives (Llama, Gemma), to assess their alignment with human moral preferences in autonomous driving scenarios.

item.title: White-Box Diffusion Transformer for single-cell RNA-seq generation
item.description: Our White-Box Diffusion Transformer combines the generative capabilities of Diffusion model with the mathematical interpretability of White-Box transformer.

item.title: Renaissance: Investigating the Pretraining of Vision-Language Encoders
item.description: In this paper we seek to answer several questions related to the pretraining of vision-language encoders through meta-analysis.

item.title: XPoint: A Self-Supervised Visual-State-Space based Architecture for Multispectral Image Registration
item.description: Accurate multispectral image matching presents significant challenges due to non-linear intensity variations across spectral modalities, extreme viewpoint changes, and the scarcity of labeled datasets.

item.title: ScaleKD: Strong Vision Transformers Could Be Excellent Teachers
item.description: The student backbones trained by our method transfer well on downstream MS-COCO and ADE20K datasets.

item.title: Variational Graph Contrastive Learning
item.description: Our approach introduces a subgraph Gaussian embedding module, which adaptively maps subgraphs to a structured Gaussian space, ensuring the preservation of graph characteristics while controlling the distribution of generated subgraphs.

item.title: T2-Only Prostate Cancer Prediction by Meta-Learning from Bi-Parametric MR Imaging
item.description: Current imaging-based prostate cancer diagnosis requires both MR T2-weighted (T2w) and diffusion-weighted imaging (DWI) sequences, with additional sequences for potentially greater accuracy improvement.

item.title: UniHR: Hierarchical Representation Learning for Unified Knowledge Graph Link Prediction
item.description: Experimental results across 7 datasets from 3 types of KGs demonstrate that our UniHR outperforms baselines designed for one specific kind of KG, indicating strong generalization capability of HiDR form and the effectiveness of HiSL module.
